homeMobile.mess_welcome: J'ai besoin d'une photo d'identité pour

headerMobile.mess_alert1: Les gouvernements exigent que la photo soit récente. Avec Smartphone iD, vous pouvez prouver la date et l'heure de la photo prise.
headerMobile.tips_title: Make sure your photo is valid!
headerMobile.title_1: Ligth fall evenly on your face
headerMobile.text_1: Make sure the area where you take the photo is well-lit, preferably with natural light. Avoid using the flash as it can cause harsh shadows or reflections.
headerMobile.text_2: By placing your hair behind your shoulders, you make sure that they don't cover your ears and face.
headerMobile.text_3: It's very hard to get a successful biometric passport photo with glasses therefore most government institutions either forbid wearing glasses or request a special justification from a doctor.
headerMobile.text_4: Government institutions don't allow smiling because it distorts the natural look necessary for automated facial biometric recognition.
headerMobile.text_5: Partially open mouth is allowed for babies, but no tongue and teeth can be seen.
headerMobile.text_6: Make sure to look at the camera objective of your phone, and not at the phone screen.
headerMobile.text_7: Make sure your head is not tilted towards one side/raised too high/bent too low. Your face should be also directly facing the phone screen.
headerMobile.title_8: Arm fully extended, in case of selfie
headerMobile.text_8: The frontal camera tends to distort face parts if it is too close. Also, make sure that your arm is not visible.
